title: virtual packages seem to be ignoring namespaces

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I created a spack repo 'hacks' with higher precedence than builtin, and when I place new versions of packages in builtin into hacks, I am not always having the 'hacks' version overriding the 'builtin' version.  This seems to be happening only with virtual packages.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

1. Clone a clean spack from git
```console 
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack.git spack.test
```
2. Copy the etc/spack/default/*.yaml config files to etc/spack.  Edit compilers.yaml to use the system default compiler.  Configure packages.yaml to make libtirpc the default provider for rpc, and libszip the default provider for szip.
3. Create a 'hacks' repo and give it higher precedence that 'builtin' (i.e. put ahead of builtin in repos.yaml)
4. Copy the following packages from builtin to hacks repo: bison, libszip, and libtirpc
5. Issue the command
```console
$ spack spec -N hdf
```
This reports:
```console
==> Warning: gcc@rh7-4.8.5 cannot build optimized binaries for "skylake". Using best target possible: "haswell"
builtin.hdf@4.2.14%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+external-xdr+fortran~java~netcdf+pic~shared+szip arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^hacks.bison@3.7.6%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.diffutils@3.7%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.libiconv@1.16%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.m4@1.4.18%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+sigsegv patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.libsigsegv@2.13%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.perl@5.32.1%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.berkeley-db@18.1.40%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+cxx~docs+stl patches=b231fcc4d5cff05e5c3a4814f6a5af0e9a966428dc2176540d2c05aff41de522 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.gdbm@1.19%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                ^builtin.readline@8.1%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                    ^builtin.ncurses@6.2%gcc@rh7-4.8.5~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                        ^builtin.pkgconf@1.7.4%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.flex@2.6.3%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+lex~nls arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.findutils@4.8.0%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.libjpeg-turbo@2.0.6%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.cmake@3.20.2%gcc@rh7-4.8.5~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt build_type=Release arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.openssl@1.1.1k%gcc@rh7-4.8.5~docs+systemcerts arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                ^builtin.zlib@1.2.11%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.nasm@2.15.05%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.libszip@2.1.1%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.libtirpc@1.2.6%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.krb5@1.18.2%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+shared patches=3d75052730690579484e65a5bf0f92f6c3b20d9c43a413862d087774f431d9e9 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
```

Note that bison dependency uses hacks.bison, but libszip and libtirpc still using builtin.
If I instead issue
```console
$ spack spec -N hdf ^libtirpc
```
I get 
```
==> Warning: gcc@rh7-4.8.5 cannot build optimized binaries for "skylake". Using best target possible: "haswell"
builtin.hdf@4.2.14%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+external-xdr+fortran~java~netcdf+pic~shared+szip arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^hacks.bison@3.7.6%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.diffutils@3.7%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.libiconv@1.16%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.m4@1.4.18%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+sigsegv patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.libsigsegv@2.13%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.perl@5.32.1%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.berkeley-db@18.1.40%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+cxx~docs+stl patches=b231fcc4d5cff05e5c3a4814f6a5af0e9a966428dc2176540d2c05aff41de522 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.gdbm@1.19%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                ^builtin.readline@8.1%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                    ^builtin.ncurses@6.2%gcc@rh7-4.8.5~symlinks+termlib abi=none arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                        ^builtin.pkgconf@1.7.4%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.flex@2.6.3%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+lex~nls arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.findutils@4.8.0%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.libjpeg-turbo@2.0.6%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.cmake@3.20.2%gcc@rh7-4.8.5~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt build_type=Release arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
            ^builtin.openssl@1.1.1k%gcc@rh7-4.8.5~docs+systemcerts arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
                ^builtin.zlib@1.2.11%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.nasm@2.15.05%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^builtin.libszip@2.1.1%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
    ^hacks.libtirpc@1.2.6%gcc@rh7-4.8.5 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
        ^builtin.krb5@1.18.2%gcc@rh7-4.8.5+shared patches=3d75052730690579484e65a5bf0f92f6c3b20d9c43a413862d087774f431d9e9 arch=linux-rhel7-haswell
```
i.e. both bison and libtirpc use 'hacks' namespace, but still using builtin.libszip.
Similarly, doing
```console
$ spack spec -N hdf ^libszip
```
results in depending on hacks.bison and hacks.libszip, but builtin.libtirpc, and I need to do
```console
$ spack spec -N hdf ^libszip ^libtirpc
```
to get all three (bison, libszip, litirpc) to use hacks.

### Expected behavior

I would expect 
```console
$ spack spec -N hdf
$ spack spec -N hdf ^libtirpc
$ spack spec -N hdf ^libszip
$spack spec -N hdf ^libszip ^libtirpc
```
to all return the same results, and that in all cases builtin.hdf would depend on hacks.bison, hacks.libszip, and hacks.libtirpc.

```consolespack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.1-2635-98cf0f5
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel7-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
```

@tgamblin on the mailing list suggested the behavior might be concretizer dependent, and so I am working on getting clingo concretizer installed in my test spack, and I will update with that information when I get a chance (but will likely be a couple of weeks).

I saw another issue (#23298 regarding namespaces, but I do not see this as obviously related.
